update.description:
Copy&paste for models inside model editor should work now, e.g. insert double pendulum inside model editor and copy and paste it. 

- also made some changes to the naming of the preview model visual in model editor - now its name is set in one place which is easier to maintain. 

- The ModelCreator_TEST now looks for `ModelPreview_0_0` visual name because there are two model creators (one created by the MainWindow and the other one we created inside the test so the extra `_0` gets appended.

jenkins [gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/654/testReport/) - ok
update.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

content.raw:
nested models hierarchy should now display correctly on left panel, d158818.

I'll address the nested joint problem later in a separate pull request. The joints are specified in the top most level so copy and paste doesn't copy over the joint descriptions.
content.html:
nested models hierarchy should now display correctly on left panel, d158818.

I'll address the nested joint problem later in a separate pull request. The joints are specified in the top most level so copy and paste doesn't copy over the joint descriptions.

update.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

pull_request.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

pullrequest.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

content.raw:
Copying deeply nested models is not working properly:

1. Open the deeply nested model world: gazebo test/worlds/deeply_nested_model.world

1. Right click the model and edit it, the model's hierarchy shows up on the model tree widget

1. Click on any of the nested models, the top level one gets selected

1. Copy and paste, all the parts seem to be there but the hierarchy does not show on the left panel. Even if you save it and reload into the editor, the hierarchy is not there. Joints between the nested models don't show either.
content.html:
Copying deeply nested models is not working properly:

  1. Open the deeply nested model world: gazebo test/worlds/deeply_nested_model.world

  2. Right click the model and edit it, the model's hierarchy shows up on the model tree widget

  3. Click on any of the nested models, the top level one gets selected

  4. Copy and paste, all the parts seem to be there but the hierarchy does not show on the left panel. Even if you save it and reload into the editor, the hierarchy is not there. Joints between the nested models don't show either.

pull_request.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

pullrequest.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

content.raw:
Copying from the context menu seems to be broken for nested models:

1. Select a link

1. Right-click a nested model (it doesn't get selected, but the context menu is right, delete works)

2.  Choose Copy

1. When you paste, it will be the link

Another scenario:

1. Click on the ground plane so nothing is selected

1. Right click a nested model - Copy is disabled
content.html:
Copying from the context menu seems to be broken for nested models:

  1. Select a link

  2. Right-click a nested model (it doesn't get selected, but the context menu is right, delete works)

  3. Choose Copy

  4. When you paste, it will be the link

Another scenario:

  1. Click on the ground plane so nothing is selected

  2. Right click a nested model - Copy is disabled
